polito.sdp2017.Components

Class SQLiteManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • polito.sdp2017.Components.SQLiteManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DBManager

    public class SQLiteManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBManager
    This class describes a database manager considering as DBMS SQLITE3. The interface between the database and the Java code is performed by JDBC. The SQLiteManager runs the queries. It is characterized by a connection, the (ABSOLUTE) path of the database and its name.

        public static boolean isSQLite3(java.lang.String dbPath)
        This method performs a preliminary check on the DBMS.
        Parameters:
        dbPath - : database path
        Returns:
        true if the DBMS is SQLite3, false otherwise

      • resetDatabase

        public void resetDatabase()
        This method erases the whole content of the database, emptying all tables. This operation is described by an sql script, which is imported by this method.
        Specified by:
        resetDatabase in interface DBManager

      • searchIP

        public java.util.LinkedList<IP> searchIP(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> listOfParameters)
        A SELECT query is executed in order to obtain all those IPs that satisfy a set of properties listed in listOfParameters. The features inside listOfParameters could't be fixed, so the query structure is floating, in order to accept different combinations of searching parameters.
        Specified by:
        searchIP in interface DBManager
        Returns:
        A linkedList of object IPs, filled by the ResultSet of the query.

      • addIP

        public void addIP(IP ipToBeAdded)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        An INSERT instruction is performed on the database.
        Specified by:
        addIP in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        ipToBeAdded - is the filled IP, ready to be inserted
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • removeIP

        public boolean removeIP(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String id,
                        boolean isCore)
        A REMOVE instruction is performed on the database. The three parameters could be accepted in any combination. It's possible to pass only the name, only the id or both of them. It is necessary to specify whether the target is a Core or a Manager.
        Specified by:
        removeIP in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        name: - it's the name of the IP to be removed.
        id: - it's the id of the IP to be removed.
        isCore: - it's referred to the fact whether the IP is a Core or a Manager
        Returns:
        true if everything ends well, otherwise false

      • searchConfiguration

        public java.util.LinkedList<FPGAConfiguration> searchConfiguration(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listOfParameters)
        A SELECT query is executed in order to obtain all those configurations that satisfy a set of properties listed in listOfParameters. Those parameters could appear in any combination, due to the fact that the queries can be built dynamically.
        Specified by:
        searchConfiguration in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        listOfParameters: - list of parameters selected by the final user.
        Returns:
        A linkedList of object FPGAConfigurations, filled by the ResultSet of the query.

      • addConfiguration

        public void addConfiguration(FPGAConfiguration conf)
        An INSERT instruction is performed on the database for an FPGAConfiguration object.
        Specified by:
        addConfiguration in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        conf - is the filled configuration, ready to be inserted

      • removeConfiguration

        public boolean removeConfiguration(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String id)
        A REMOVE instruction is performed on the database for an FPGAConfiguration object. The two parameters could be accepted in any combination. It's possible to pass only the name, only the id or both of them.
        Specified by:
        removeConfiguration in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        name: - it's the name of the configuration to be removed.
        id: - it's the id of the configuration to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if everything ends well, otherwise false
